case_title: G.V.K. INDUSTRIES LIMITED and another vs INCOME-TAX OFFICER and another
complaint_summary: The petitioner-company sought a 'no objection certificate' under Section 195 of the Income Tax Act, 1961, to remit Rs. 5.4 crores to ABB-Projects and Trade Finance (International) Ltd., Zurich, Switzerland (NRC). The Income-Tax Officer refused the certificate, citing tax liability under Sections 9(1)(i) and 9(1)(vii)(b). The petitioner argued that NRC had no business connection in India and rendered services entirely from outside India.
investigation_summary: The Income-Tax Officer and Commissioner of Income-Tax concluded that the NRC had a business connection with the petitioner-company, citing correspondence and services rendered. They determined that the 'success fee' fell under managerial and consultancy services, taxable under Section 9(1)(vii)(b). The petitioner argued that the NRC operated independently from Zurich and had no office or business connection in India.

judgment_summary.decision: The 'success fee' is chargeable under the provisions of the Income Tax Act, 1961.
judgment_summary.no_objection_certificate: Petitioner-company not entitled to 'no objection certificate'.

contentions: NRC rendered services from outside India and had no business connection in India.
Success fee does not accrue or arise in India under Section 9(1)(i) or 9(1)(vii).
Petitioner-company was not an agent of NRC.
NRC provided managerial and consultancy services.
Income deemed to accrue or arise in India under Section 9(1)(i) and 9(1)(vii)(b).
Petitioner-company acted on behalf of NRC for processing loans.

key_issues: Whether the 'success fee' payable to NRC is chargeable under the Income Tax Act, 1961.
Whether the petitioner-company is entitled to a 'no objection certificate' under Section 195.

facts.project_details: Constructed a power generating station with a capacity of 235 MW near Rajahmundry, Andhra Pradesh
facts.consultant: ABB--Projects and Trade Finance (International) Ltd., Zurich, Switzerland (NRC)
facts.application_section: Section 195 of the Income Tax Act, 1961

court_findings.business_connection: No business connection established between petitioner-company and NRC.
court_findings.technical_services: Success fee falls within the ambit of 'fees for technical services' under Section 9(1)(vii)(b).
court_findings.legislative_validity: Section 9(1)(vii)(b) upheld as valid by previous judgments.

legal_terms.business connection: A real and intimate relationship contributing to the earning of income by a non-resident in India.
legal_terms.fees for technical services: Consideration for managerial, technical, or consultancy services.

words_and_phrases.success fee: Payment contingent upon successful financial closure of debt financing.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the applicability of Sections 9(1)(i) and 9(1)(vii)(b) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, concerning the taxability of fees paid to a non-resident entity for consultancy services. The court dismissed the petition, holding the fees taxable under Section 9(1)(vii)(b).
